item.title: Improve Cloud Performance With Direct Network Access
item.description: By: John Shepler Many companies are experiencing buyer’s remorse after transitioning to the cloud. They expected cost savings, increased performance, and limitless resources, but instead, they’re facing performance issues. The problem likely isn’t the cloud service itself, but the connection used to access it. While your current internet connection might be sufficient for tasks like file transfers and email, it’s not ideal for real-time applications like VoIP, video conferencing, or cloud-based software.
